properties.address: Aspire Ryde, Ryde, Isle of Wight PO33 2BN
properties.description: Our Community Kitchen Team run a welcome warm space with access to a free Community Lunch four day a week. We are open to all of our Community Members and offer a welcoming, supportive, inclusive space. We also offer signposting, support and advice to enable people to access other community assets.
properties.title: Aspire Community Lunch & Warm Space

properties.address: 8 York Road, Sandown, Isle of Wight PO36 8ET
properties.title: Coffee Morning

properties.address: Downside Community Centre, Isle of Wight PO30 2AX
properties.description: Pan Together is an Island charity which exists to support and provide a community hub for the residents of East Newport, which includes the Isle of Wight's most disadvantaged area. Our purpose-built centre comprises: a community cafe providing wholesome, affordable food whilst also acting as a social hub; an IT learning suite; two community rooms; a large training kitchen; and an outside produce-growing area. We provide: vital signposting and support for people needing help and advice; we help to avert social isolation; there are free courses in Maths, English and IT; free weekly drop-in sessions for people wanting to brush up their skills and/or get help with their CV and/or are thinking about returning to work after a break; volunteering and work experience opportunities; social activities such as bingo; cookery sessions for children and vulnerable families; and a new money management advice and form-filling service to support people in these tough economic times. We run a community larder twice a week for local residents. Members pay £5 per weekly visit for two carrier bags of fresh, frozen, refrigerated, tinned and dried food and other household essentials which they choose for themselves. If they pick wisely, they'll receive £20 to £30 of goods and no one needs a referral.
properties.title: Downside Community Centre

properties.address: Utilita, Newport, Isle of Wight PO30 1TP
properties.description: Utilita Energy Hubs are designed to be welcoming community spaces, and the phrase "the kettle will always be on" is used to emphasize their friendly and accessible nature, not just for Utilita customers, but for anyone who needs advice or a place to relax. They offer advice on energy bills, a comfortable space for people to gather, and a friendly face for those in need.
properties.title: Utilita Energy Hub

properties.description: An Energy Hub that has a community room along with a kids table where they can play some games on the available tablets or do some colouring in. We serve hot drinks and run Energy Efficiency workshops, to show how you can save money on your household bills.
properties.title: Utilita Energy Hub (IOW)
